00033 struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value
00034 {
00035 #ifdef WINDOWS
00036     HANDLE mutex;
00037 #else
00038     pthread_mutex_t mutex;
00039 #endif
00040 };
00041 #ifdef WINDOWS
00042 static HANDLE *mutex_buf;
00043 #else
00044 static pthread_mutex_t *mutex_buf;
00045 #endif
00046 static void dyn_lock_function(int mode, struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line);
00047 static void dyn_destroy_function(struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line);
00048 static struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *dyn_create_function(const char *file, int line);
00049 static void locking_function(int mode, int n, const char *file, int line);
00050 static unsigned long id_function(void);
00051 SSLServer::SSLServer() 
00052 {
00053         cert_file = "";
00054         priv_key_file = "";
00055         ctx = NULL;
00056 }

00063         ctx = NULL;
00064         mutex_buf = NULL;

00073 
00074 int SSLServer::tls_init(void)
00075 {
00076     int i;
00077 
00078         SSL_load_error_strings();
00079         SSL_library_init();
00080     // Load algorithms and error strings.
00081         OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
00082     /* static locks area */
00083 #ifdef WINDOWS
00084     mutex_buf = (HANDLE *) malloc(CRYPTO_num_locks() * sizeof(HANDLE));
00085 #else
00086     mutex_buf = (pthread_mutex_t *) malloc(CRYPTO_num_locks() * sizeof(pthread_mutex_t));
00087 #endif
00088     if (mutex_buf == NULL)
00089         return (0);
00090     for (i = 0; i < CRYPTO_num_locks(); i++)
00091     {
00092 #ifdef WINDOWS
00093         mutex_buf[i] = CreateMutex( NULL, FALSE, NULL );
00094 #else
00095         pthread_mutex_init(&mutex_buf[i], NULL);
00096 #endif
00097     }
00098     /* static locks callbacks */
00099     CRYPTO_set_locking_callback(locking_function);
00100     CRYPTO_set_id_callback(id_function);
00101     /* dynamic locks callbacks */
00102     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_create_callback(dyn_create_function);
00103     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_lock_callback(dyn_lock_function);
00104     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_destroy_callback(dyn_destroy_function);
00105 #ifndef WINDOWS
00106     RAND_load_file("/dev/urandom", 1024);
00107 //  OpenSSL uses several sources of entropy automatically on Windows 
00108 #endif
00109     return (1);
00110 }
00111 /**********************************************************************************************/
00112 
00113 int SSLServer::tls_cleanup(void)
00114 {
00115     int i;
00116 
00117     if (mutex_buf == NULL)
00118         return (0);
00119     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_create_callback(NULL);
00120     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_lock_callback(NULL);
00121     CRYPTO_set_dynlock_destroy_callback(NULL);
00122 
00123     CRYPTO_set_locking_callback(NULL);
00124     CRYPTO_set_id_callback(NULL);
00125 
00126     for (i = 0; i < CRYPTO_num_locks(); i++)
00127     {
00128 #ifdef WINDOWS
00129         CloseHandle(mutex_buf[i]);
00130 #else
00131         pthread_mutex_destroy(&mutex_buf[i]);
00132 #endif
00133     }
00134     free(mutex_buf);
00135     mutex_buf = NULL;
00136     return (1);
00137 }

00167 
00168 int SSLServer::CreateCTX(void) 
00169 {
00170 generic_server *fwork = generic_server::pinstance;
00171 ostringstream oss;
00172 // The method describes which SSL protocol we will be using.
00173 #if (OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x10000000L) // openssl returns a const SSL_METHOD
00174         const SSL_METHOD *method = NULL;
00175 #else
00176         SSL_METHOD *method = NULL;
00177 #endif
00178         STACK_OF(X509_NAME) *cert_names;
00179         // Compatible with SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLSv1
00180         method = SSLv23_server_method();
00181         //method = TLSv1_server_method();
00182 
00183         // Create new context from method.
00184         ctx = SSL_CTX_new(method);
00185         if(ctx == NULL) 
00186                 return(0);
00187         SSL_CTX_set_mode(ctx,SSL_MODE_AUTO_RETRY);
00188         cert_names = SSL_load_client_CA_file(ca_certificate.c_str());
00189         if (cert_names != NULL)
00190                 SSL_CTX_set_client_CA_list(ctx, cert_names);
00191         else
00192                 return(0);
00193         if(!SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx,ca_certificate.c_str(),NULL))
00194         if(verify_client)
00195                 SSL_CTX_set_verify(ctx,SSL_VERIFY_PEER|SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT,0);
00196         return(1);
00197 }
00198 /**********************************************************************************************/
00199 
00200 /* Load the certification files, ie the public and private keys. */
00201 int SSLServer::LoadCerts(void) 
00202 {
00203         if ( SSL_CTX_use_certificate_chain_file(ctx, cert_file.c_str()) <= 0) 
00204                 return(0);
00205         if ( SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey_file(ctx, priv_key_file.c_str(), SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) <= 0) 
00206                 return(0);
00207         // Verify that the two keys goto together.
00208         if ( !SSL_CTX_check_private_key(ctx) ) 
00209                 return(0);
00210         return(1);
00211 }
00212 /**********************************************************************************************/
00222 static void locking_function(int mode, int n, const char *file, int line)
00223 {
00224     if (mode & CRYPTO_LOCK)
00225     {
00226 #ifdef WINDOWS
00227         DWORD dwWaitResult;
00228         dwWaitResult = WaitForSingleObject(mutex_buf[n],INFINITE);
00229 #else
00230         pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex_buf[n]);
00231 #endif
00232     }
00233     else
00234     {
00235 #ifdef WINDOWS
00236         ReleaseMutex(mutex_buf[n]);
00237 #else
00238         pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex_buf[n]);
00239 #endif
00240     }
00241 }
00242 /**********************************************************************************************/
00243 
00249 static unsigned long id_function(void)
00250 {
00251 #ifdef WINDOWS
00252         return(unsigned long) GetCurrentThreadId();
00253         //return(1);
00254 #else
00255     return ((unsigned long) pthread_self());
00256 #endif
00257 }

00260 static struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *dyn_create_function(const char *file, int line)
00261 {
00262     struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *value;
00263 
00264         value = NULL;
00265     value = (struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *) malloc(sizeof(struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value));
00266     if (!value) 
00267         return(NULL);
00268 #ifdef WINDOWS
00269         value->mutex = CreateMutex( NULL, FALSE, NULL );
00270 #else
00271     pthread_mutex_init(&value->mutex, NULL);
00272 #endif
00273     return value;
00274 }
00275 /**********************************************************************************************/
00276 
00277 static void dyn_lock_function(int mode, struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line)
00278 {
00279     if (mode & CRYPTO_LOCK) 
00280         {
00281 #ifdef WINDOWS
00282         DWORD dwWaitResult;
00283         dwWaitResult = WaitForSingleObject(l->mutex,INFINITE);
00284 #else
00285         pthread_mutex_lock(&l->mutex);
00286 #endif
00287     } 
00288         else 
00289         {
00290 #ifdef WINDOWS
00291         ReleaseMutex(l->mutex);
00292 #else
00293         pthread_mutex_unlock(&l->mutex);
00294 #endif
00295     }
00296 }
00297 /**********************************************************************************************/
00298 
00299 static void dyn_destroy_function(struct CRYPTO_dynlock_value *l,const char *file, int line)
00300 {
00301 #ifdef WINDOWS
00302         CloseHandle(l->mutex);
00303 #else
00304     pthread_mutex_destroy(&l->mutex);
00305 #endif
00306     free(l);
00307 }
